pull.title: Cluster mempool followups
pull.body:
As suggested in the main cluster mempool PR (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28676#pullrequestreview-3177119367), I've pulled out some of the non-essential optimizations and cleanups into this separate PR.  

Will continue to add more commits here to address non-blocking suggestions/improvements as they come up.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33591.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#33725](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33725) (ci, iwyu: Treat warnings as errors for `src/init` and `src/policy` by hebasto)
* [#33724](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33724) (refactor: Return uint64_t from GetSerializeSize by maflcko)
* [#33629](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33629) (Cluster mempool by sdaftuar)
* [#33616](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33616) (policy: don't CheckEphemeralSpends on reorg by instagibbs)
* [#33421](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33421) (node: add  `BlockTemplate{Cache, Manager}` by ismaelsadeeq)
* [#33214](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33214) (rpc: require integer verbosity; remove boolean 'verbose' by fqlx)
* [#33191](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33191) (net: Provide block templates to peers on request by ajtowns)
* [#32587](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32587) (test: Fix reorg patterns in tests to use proper fork-based approach by yuvicc)
* [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors)
* [#31682](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31682) ([IBD] specialize CheckBlock's input & coinbase checks by l0rinc)
* [#31382](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31382) (kernel: Flush in ChainstateManager destructor by TheCharlatan)
* [#30277](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30277) ([DO NOT MERGE] Erlay: bandwidth-efficient transaction relay protocol (Full implementation) by sr-gi)
* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo over LogPrintf [WIP, NOMERGE, DRAFT] by maflcko)
* [#28690](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28690) (build: Introduce internal kernel library by TheCharlatan)
* [#17783](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17783) (common: Disallow calling IsArgSet() on ALLOW_LIST options by ryanofsky)
* [#17581](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17581) (refactor: Remove settings merge reverse precedence code by ryanofsky)
* [#17580](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17580) (refactor: Add ALLOW_LIST flags and enforce usage in CheckArgFlags by ryanofsky)
* [#17493](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17493) (util: Forbid ambiguous multiple assignments in config file by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->
### LLM Linter (✨ experimental)

Possible typos and grammar issues:

- to to -> to [duplicate word; makes the sentence read "to to have" which is incorrect]
- 101kvB -> 101 k vB (or "101 kVBytes") [unit is written without spacing/standard form and is confusing; add spacing or use a standard unit]
- rule 5). -> rule 5) [stray/full stop after a parenthesis; "rule 5)." is awkward/confusing — use "rule 5)"]

<sup>drahtbot_id_5_m</sup>

events.message: Allow moving an Epoch::Marker

mempool: Store iterators into mapTx in mapNextTx

This takes the same amount of space as CTransaction pointers, and saves a map
lookup in many common uses.
Allow moving CTxMemPoolEntry objects, disallow copying
Make CTxMemPoolEntry derive from TxGraph::Ref
Create a txgraph inside CTxMemPool
Add sigops adjusted weight calculator
Add accessor for sigops-adjusted weight

Add transactions to txgraph, but without cluster dependencies

Effectively this is treating all transactions in txgraph as being in a cluster
of size 1.
Add new (unused) limits for cluster size/count

test: update feature_rbf.py replacement test

Preparatory commit to the rbf functional test, before changes are made to the
rbf rules as part of cluster mempool.
[test] rework/delete feature_rbf tests requiring large clusters

Do not allow mempool clusters to exceed configured limits

Include an adjustment to mempool_tests.cpp due to the additional memory used by
txgraph.

Includes a temporary change to the mempool_ephemeral_dust.py functional test,
due to validation checks being reordered. This change will revert once the RBF
rules are changed in a later commit.
Check cluster limits when using -walletrejectlongchains
Rework miner_tests to not require large cluster limit

Limit mempool size based on chunk feerate

Rather than evicting the transactions with the lowest descendant feerate,
instead evict transactions that have the lowest chunk feerate.

Once mining is implemented based on choosing transactions with highest chunk
feerate (see next commit), mining and eviction will be opposites, so that we
will evict the transactions that would be mined last.
bench: rewrite ComplexMemPool to not create oversized clusters

Select transactions for blocks based on chunk feerate

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Sanders <gsanders87@gmail.com>
test: rewrite PopulateMempool to not violate mempool policy (cluster size) limits

policy: Remove CPFP carveout rule

The addition of a cluster size limit makes the CPFP carveout rule useless,
because carveout cannot be used to bypass the cluster size limit. Remove this
policy rule and update tests to no longer rely on the behavior.

Implement new RBF logic for cluster mempool

With a total ordering on mempool transactions, we are now able to calculate a
transaction's mining score at all times. Use this to improve the RBF logic:

- we no longer enforce a "no new unconfirmed parents" rule

- we now require that the mempool's feerate diagram must improve in order
  to accept a replacement

- the topology restrictions for conflicts in the package rbf setting have been
  eliminated

Revert the temporary change to mempool_ephemeral_dust.py that were previously
made due to RBF validation checks being reordered.

Co-authored-by: Gregory Sanders <gsanders87@gmail.com>, glozow <gloriajzhao@gmail.com>
Remove the ancestor and descendant indices from the mempool

Use cluster linearization for transaction relay sort order

Previously, transaction batches were first sorted by ancestor count and then
feerate, to ensure transactions are announced in a topologically valid order,
while prioritizing higher feerate transactions. Ancestor count is a crude
topological sort criteria, so replace this with linearization order so that the
highest feerate transactions (as would be observed by the mining algorithm) are
relayed before lower feerate ones, in a topologically valid way.

This also fixes a test that only worked due to the ancestor-count-based sort
order.

Remove CTxMemPool::GetSortedDepthAndScore

The mempool clusters and linearization permit sorting the mempool topologically
without making use of ancestor counts (as long as the graph is not oversized).

Co-authored-by: Pieter Wuille <pieter@wuille.net>

Reimplement GetTransactionAncestry() to not rely on cached data

In preparation for removing ancestor data from CTxMemPoolEntry, recalculate the
ancestor statistics on demand wherever needed.
rpc: Calculate ancestor data from scratch for mempool rpc calls
Remove dependency on cached ancestor data in mini-miner

Stop enforcing ancestor size/count limits

The cluster limits should be sufficient.

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Sanders <gsanders87@gmail.com>
Add test case for cluster size limits to TRUC logic

Use mempool/txgraph to determine if a tx has descendants

Remove a reference to GetCountWithDescendants() in preparation for removing
this function and the associated cached state from the mempool.

Calculate descendant information for mempool RPC output on-the-fly

This is in preparation for removing the cached descendant state from the
mempool.
test: remove rbf carveout test from mempool_limit.py

Stop enforcing descendant size/count limits

Cluster size limits should be enough.

Eliminate RBF workaround for CPFP carveout transactions

The new cluster mempool RBF rules take into account clusters sizes exactly, so
with the removal of descendant count enforcement this idea is obsolete.

wallet: Replace max descendantsize with clustersize

With the descendant size limits removed, replace the concept of "max number of
descendants of any ancestor of a given tx" with the cluster count of the cluster
that the transaction belongs to.
mempool: Remove unused function CalculateDescendantMaximum
Eliminate use of cached ancestor data in miniminer_tests and truc_policy
mempool: eliminate accessors to mempool entry ancestor/descendant cached state
Remove unused members from CTxMemPoolEntry
Remove mempool logic designed to maintain ancestor/descendant state
mempool: addUnchecked no longer needs ancestors
Remove unused limits from CalculateMemPoolAncestors
Make removeConflicts private

Simplify ancestor calculation functions

Now that ancestor calculation never fails (due to ancestor/descendant limits
being eliminated), we can eliminate the error handling from
CalculateMemPoolAncestors.
Use txgraph to calculate ancestors
Use txgraph to calculate descendants
Rework truc_policy to use descendants, not children

Rework RBF and TRUC validation

Calculating mempool ancestors for a new transaction should not be done until
after cluster size limits have been enforced, to limit CPU DoS potential.

Achieve this by reworking TRUC and RBF validation logic:

- TRUC policy enforcement is now done using only mempool parents of
  new transactions, not all mempool ancestors (note that it's fine to calculate
  ancestors of in-mempool transactions, if the number of such calls is
  reasonably bounded).
- RBF replacement checks are performed earlier (which allows for checking
  cluster size limits earlier, because cluster size checks cannot happen until
  after all conflicts are staged for removal).
- Verifying that a new transaction doesn't conflict with an ancestor now
  happens later, in AcceptSingleTransaction() rather than in PreChecks(). This
  means that the test is not performed at all in AcceptMultipleTransactions(),
  but in package acceptance we already disallow RBF in situations where a
  package transaction has in-mempool parents.

Also to ensure that all RBF validation logic is applied in both the single
transaction and multiple transaction cases, remove the optimization that skips
the PackageMempoolChecks() in the case of a single transaction being validated
in AcceptMultipleTransactions().
Make getting parents/children a function of the mempool, not a mempool entry
Eliminate CheckPackageLimits, which no longer does anything
Fix miniminer_tests to work with cluster limits
Rewrite GatherClusters to use the txgraph implementation
Stop tracking parents/children outside of txgraph

Avoid violating mempool policy limits in tests

Changes AddToMempool() helper to only apply changes if the mempool limits are
respected.

Fix package_rbf fuzz target to handle mempool policy violations

bench: add more mempool benchmarks

Add benchmarks for:

  - adding a transaction
  - calculating mempool ancestors/descendants

fuzz: try to add more code coverage for mempool fuzzing

Including test coverage for mempool eviction and expiry

Expose cluster information via rpc

Co-authored-by: glozow <gloriajzhao@gmail.com>
doc: Update mempool_replacements.md to reflect feerate diagram checks

test: add functional test for new cluster mempool RPCs

Co-authored-by: glozow <gloriajzhao@gmail.com>

fuzz: remove comparison between mini_miner block construction and miner

This is in preparation for eliminating the block template building happening in
mini_miner, in favor of directly using the linearizations done in the mempool.
Invoke TxGraph::DoWork() at appropriate times
Update comments for CTxMemPool class

Add check that GetSortedScoreWithTopology() agrees with CompareMiningScoreWithTopology()

We use CompareMiningScoreWithTopology() for sorting transaction announcements
during tx relay, and we use GetSortedScoreWithTopology() in
CTxMemPool::check().
doc: update policy/packages.md for new package acceptance logic

test: extend package rbf functional test to larger clusters

Co-Authored-By: Gregory Sanders <gsanders87@gmail.com>
Sanity check `GetFeerateDiagram()` in CTxMemPool::check()
==== FOLLOWUPS ====
Remove unused variable (cacheMap) in mempool
Remove unused argument to RemoveStaged
Simplify removeRecursive

scripted-diff: rename AddToMempool -> TryAddToMempool

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
find src/test -type f -exec sed -i 's/AddToMempool/TryAddToMempool/g' {} +
find src/bench -type f -exec sed -i 's/AddToMempool/TryAddToMempool/g' {} +
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-
Rewrite removeForReorg to avoid using sets
Rewrite GetChildren without sets
Invoke removeUnchecked() directly in removeForBlock()
Warn user if using -limitancestorsize/-limitdescendantsize that the options have no effect
Use cluster limit rather than descendant limit to sanity check mempool max size
Remove ancestor and descendant vsize limits from MemPoolLimits
Use cluster limits instead of ancestor/descendant limits when sanity checking package policy limits
Use cluster size limit instead of ancestor/descendant size limits when sanity checking TRUC policy limits
Use cluster size limit instead of ancestor size limit in txpackage unit test
Remove unused DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_SIZE_LIMIT_KVB and DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_SIZE_LIMIT_KVB
Add a GetFeePerVSize() accessor to CFeeRate, and use it in the BlockAssembler

miner: replace "package" with "chunk"

This makes the terminology consistent with other parts of the codebase, as part
of the cluster mempool implementation.
doc: Update mempool-limits.md for cluster mempool

doc: add design notes for cluster mempool

For now, just link to the long writeups on delvingbitcoin.org
doc: add release notes snippet for cluster mempool
